climbs.name: Unforgiven
climbs.fa: Chris Miller, Pete Paredes and Chuck Scott, July 2001

content.description:
Lieback a large, left-facing flake past two bolts which pinches down a bit higher forming a small roof. Clip the 3rd bolt and then fire over the roof (5.11) on slick edges until possible to gain the security of a finger slot. From here climb the right arete/face of the formation (5.9) past two bolts to anchors on a ledge.

Good moves on this route but lacking the continuous nature of the routes further left.
content.location:
Head up past the start of

Pistol Pete

and

Doc's Holiday

and then scramble atop a block to reach the start of this route.

content.description: Fun climbing up mostly big holds and edges will get you to the anchors of this small climb with a big view. The rock quality is good and very reminiscent of the climbs on nearby Coyote Crag but with it's somewhat isolated position you can expect little to no crowds on this one.
content.location:
This route is located on a small face that's actually the backside of the Claimjumper Wall but since it's approached from the Doc Holiday Wall it's listed here.

Walk/scramble up a rocky gully around and left from

Quick on the Draw

to reach the base of the route.

content.description: Route starts on the left side of a dark slab. Climb the thin slab past two bolts (optional use of long draw on the 2nd bolt) to a sloping ledge below the main face.  Straight forward climbing up some large plates and goodies to bolted anchors.
content.protection:
5 bolts, chain anchor

(all bolts 1/2" SS)

* Bolts replaced 2019

climbs.name: Pistol Pete
climbs.fa: Chris Miller, Pete Paredes & Chuck Scott, July 2001

content.description: Climb the slab passing two bolts (use a long draw or runner on the 2nd bolt) to a sloping ledge below the main face. Clip the third bolt, work up and right via an undercling flake and then continue up the featured face/arete to a small stance at the 7th bolt. Above here the climb changes character (again) and finishes up the exposed slabby arete via delicate, balancy moves.
content.location:
Starts from ground level 15 feet right of

Quick on the Draw

and climbs the right side of a dark slab before heading up the left side of the main face.

content.description: Located on the far right side of Doc Holliday wall.  Climb past a few horizontal breaks and over a small roof to anchor.
Found on right hand side of crag and just right of large crack system.
content.location: Second route from the right and just next to Loose Women, Loose Rock.

climbs.name: Doc's Holiday
climbs.fa: (TR) Brad Singer & Mike Rigney, 1989, FL: Rich Scholes & Mike Rigney, 1990, Direct Start: Pete Paredes, Chuck Scott, Chris Miller & Nathan Mitts, 7/01

content.description:
Easy moves past three bolts lead up a featured face to the base of the smooth headwall. Clip the 4th bolt and then head up the steep, smooth face using small but positive crimps that appear just as you need them. After clipping the last bolt head straight up on jugs to finish on a small ledge with anchors.

The bottom portion of this was originally climbed via a loose hand crack to the right; years later a direct start was added which boosted the popularity of this quality route.
content.protection:
8 bolts, chain anchors

(all bolts 1/2 inch SS)

* Bolts replaced 2019
content.location:
Scramble up 20' right of

Pistol Pete

to reach this area classic which tackles the smooth-looking face up the middle of the formation.
